required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Prevalence of Micronutrient Deficiency in Early School-age Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Prevalence of Micronutrient Deficiency in Early School-age Children and Its Correlation With Eating Behavior, Dietary Habits, Development, Physical Activity, Nutritional Status and Health Status

brief_summary.textblock: This study aim to assess the prevalence of deficiency in micronutrients in early school-age children and its correlation with picky eating behavior, physical activity, nutritional status, and health status.

detailed_description.textblock: A structured questionnaire is used to conduct a cross-sectional descriptive study of 250 early school-age children aged 4-7 years (<7 years old) in Taiwan. Data collection would include: demographics, food preferences, eating behavior, body weight and height, body mass index (BMI), physical activity, records of medical illness, peripheral cell blood count, serum values of ferritin and micronutrients (iron, zinc, copper). Data from children define as picky or non-picky eaters base on parental' questionnaire responses, are analyzed and compared using standard statistical tests. The correlations among eating behavior, dietary habits, development, physical activity, nutritional status, and health status, and micronutrient deficiency are evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Change serum concentrations of Hb (g/dL) may be found in children's serum
primary_outcome.description: Change serum concentrations of Hb (g/dL) may be found in children with picky eating behavior, low quality of development, inadequacy of physical activity, undernutrition, and poor health status.

primary_outcome.measure: Change serum concentrations of ferritin (ng/ mL) may be found in children's serum
primary_outcome.description: Change serum concentrations of ferritin (ng/ mL) may be found in children with picky eating behavior, low quality of development, inadequacy of physical activity, undernutrition, and poor health status.

primary_outcome.measure: Change serum concentrations of iron (μg/dL), zinc (μg/dL), and copper (μg/dL) may be found in children's serum
primary_outcome.description: Change serum concentrations of iron (μg/dL), zinc (μg/dL), and copper (μg/dL) may be found in children with picky eating behavior, low quality of development, inadequacy of physical activity, undernutrition, and poor health status.

study_pop.textblock: This cross-sectional descriptive study uses a structured questionnaire to elicit information from parents in Taiwan who are early school-age children aged 4-7 years (<7 years old). Participants are recruited from clinic in Chang Gung Children's medical center, Chang Gung Memorial Hospital. A total of 250 participants who meet the eligibility criteria are enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 4-7 years old (<7 years old) school-age children, legal representatives willing to sign the consent form and fill in the questionnaire
Exclusion Criteria:
- At the time of the enrollment, there is an acute infection (respiratory, gastrointestinal or urinary tract), and there are organic diseases (heart, lung, brain, hepatobiliary, kidney, endocrine metabolic disease or heredity).
